urls.title: Report incident locations efficiently | what3words
urls.description: Use our free toolkit with posters, images and videos to get started. If you‚Äôre using what3words for incident reporting, we‚Äôd love to hear about

text: @EnvAgency @GW4FreshCDT This is obfuscation at best, and deliberately misleading at worst.  This situation does not require a good PR job.  It needs a complete overhaul of the system, and full consultation with the science experts.

Beccy Speight of @Natures_Voice: feels as though we're going through a time of change at the moment, she thinks we may be changing how we think about the countryside. 

Vanessa Griffiths of @EnvAgency agrees and says it's vital that everyone works together.
RT @EMorfett: Meanwhile in Herefordshire we await the actions of the Nutrient Management Board. So far it has failed to stop the destructio‚Ä¶
RT @DevonWildlife: The historic concrete culvert in a tributary of the Torridge represented a barrier to fish movement. The old quarry trac‚Ä¶
@LizFlowerPower @EdenRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW @networkrail @AquaUoS I would if I had any. (I drive freight trains!) üòé

You may have heard: *all* England's rivers are now polluted. 

So, what's going in to *your* local river? The @EnvAgency to their credit have produced this interactive map: https://t.co/LKAUTI9gX9

To give you a (chemically) flavour, this is my local river, the Cherwell: https://t.co/eAJBacRFlQ

urls.title: Environment Agency - Catchment Data Explorer
urls.description: We are working towards launching a new version of the Catchment Data Explorer and API. The Catchment Data Explorer helps you explore and download information about the water environment. It supports and builds upon the data in the river basin management plans here. You can find catchments and water bodies of interest using a map or searching by name. You can also view summary information about catchments, and follow links to other useful sites. Place name: searches for River Basin Districts, catchments
